body:
Only if you make up ways to get around them. For example dispensationalism is a popular one, despite being pretty much pulled out of their asses. Even in the New Testament alone, you really have to stretch the interpretations of a lot of things to make them fit, even if it's technically possible.

Nearly all early traditions interpreted it symbolically. Including authors in the Bible itself, a classic example is Paul's usage of "You shall not muzzle a cow in its threshing".
body_html:
Only if you make up ways to get around them. For example dispensationalism is a popular one, despite being pretty much pulled out of their asses. Even in the New Testament alone, you really have to stretch the interpretations of a lot of things to make them fit, even if it's technically possible.

Nearly all early traditions interpreted it symbolically. Including authors in the Bible itself, a classic example is Paul's usage of "You shall not muzzle a cow in its threshing".

guild.description:
This guild is to serve as a communication medium for fellow believers. The bible is the ultimate source of authority for any and all doctrine or doctrinal disputes. Posts can be made questioning the validity/veracity of the bible itself, but in any conversation wherein the topic itself is not the legitimacy of the bible, then it is assumed to be correct and factual. How else can any foundation be established except if the bible is a source of truth? Is man's opinion above God's word?

To the greatest extent possible i will avoid all forms of censorship, even spam would ideally be dealt with by down-voting rather than deleting. There is no restriction on post-type (you can post whatever you want) aside from the obvious nono's like porn, spam, calls to violence, etc..

To the greatest extent possible i will avoid all forms of censorship, even spam would ideally be dealt with by down-voting rather than deleting. There is no restriction on post-type (you can post whatever you want) aside from the obvious nono's like porn, spam, calls to violence, etc..
guild.name: JesusChrist

parent.body:
Thats what everyone says, and yet for every 10 supposed contradictions i look into, there **might** be one that I struggle to reconcile.  I've looked at and researched easily over 100 contradictions, and there is only one or two that I am yet unable to reconcile.

Believe whatever you want, but the bible is not full of contradictions.

Believe whatever you want, but the bible is not full of contradictions.

post.title: If you think the bible is mostly symbolic

body:
Why do you think Jesus thought it should be obvious that marriage ends in the next age? Because we will be *like angels*, and there are not male and female angels, therefore they do not marry, nor will we. And without sex what is the point of gender?

> the diseased and disabled bodies are restored to perfection in the afterlife (at least in heaven)

But were they not born that way? By the logic of your OP, isn't that how they're supposed to be?
body_html:

the diseased and disabled bodies are restored to perfection in the afterlife (at least in heaven)

But were they not born that way? By the logic of your OP, isn't that how they're supposed to be?

"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

post.body: Correct this if it's wrong but Scripture or Tradition doesn't seem to indicate heaven will be genderless (the body is to be resurrected and perfected), hence transgender people who try to change their gender here are kind of in conflict with not only their temporal (or earthly) identity but even their eternal identity that exists without end

post.body: There are still some awesome users, but a lot of the people that I have came to enjoy reading their content have been banned, and some of the other users have left voluntarily. With the way things have been going I wouldn't be too surprised to see the rest of them wiped out in 2 weeks. If anyone knows of a site similar in feel to ruqqus from the summer of 2020, please let me know.

body: Even last summer was the beginning of the end. That's when I first started warning about it, and no one believed me. I think the pivotal moment was the creation of the Ruqqus discord, especially the gated/secret channels and servers, because the admins formed cliques there and ignored their own site more and more. It has been the root cause of basically all of this.

body: A prophet is merely an intermediary, someone who delivers a message. It doesn't make anything they themselves do, think, or say of more value. Probably the reason they're needed in the first place is to take advantage of the human compulsion to worship a strong leader, because otherwise they're not going to listen. The Psalms were actually authored by these people and not merely copied, and most of them are probably pseudographical anyway.
body_html: A prophet is merely an intermediary, someone who delivers a message. It doesn't make anything they themselves do, think, or say of more value. Probably the reason they're needed in the first place is to take advantage of the human compulsion to worship a strong leader, because otherwise they're not going to listen. The Psalms were actually authored by these people and not merely copied, and most of them are probably pseudographical anyway.

parent.body:
David said in 2 Samuel 23:2
The Spirit of the LORD spake by me, And his word was in my tongue.

I'm pretty sure that makes him a prophet. So it stands to reason that some of his psalms would have prophetic insights.

body:
> Well, if you think that it's impossible that a virgin can give birth, then you must also believe that this Isaiah prophesy is wrong, which would mean the Torah is corrupt.

Isaiah is a prophet not the Torah, and it says young woman not virgin. The virgin birth was added to Matthew and Luke by the church based on a mistranslation in the Greek Old Testament, and the attempts to smooth it over are very obvious. They both used to begin with "In the days of Herod..." as in Q and start with John's baptizing.

That said the Torah is just as corrupt as the New Testament, if not more. Luckily the original notes of the early witnesses are still within the canonical gospels, and I think Luke and to a lesser extent Mark are probably authentic, albeit altered by the church.
body_html:
Well, if you think that it's impossible that a virgin can give birth, then you must also believe that this Isaiah prophesy is wrong, which would mean the Torah is corrupt.

Isaiah is a prophet not the Torah, and it says young woman not virgin. The virgin birth was added to Matthew and Luke by the church based on a mistranslation in the Greek Old Testament, and the attempts to smooth it over are very obvious. They both used to begin with "In the days of Herod..." as in Q and start with John's baptizing.

That said the Torah is just as corrupt as the New Testament, if not more. Luckily the original notes of the early witnesses are still within the canonical gospels, and I think Luke and to a lesser extent Mark are probably authentic, albeit altered by the church.

parent.body:
Mathew 1:23 which is referencing Isaiah 7:14.

Well, if you think that it's impossible that a virgin can give birth, then you must also believe that this Isaiah prophesy is wrong, which would mean the Torah is corrupt. If you think virgin birth is possible, then why not Jesus? We know Joseph isn't his father, so...

This is the first time im hearing about lo-ammi, but what i can gather from google is that its a period of time where God rejects the Isreal people and deals with all nations. I'm not sure, but that seems to support Paul in his claim that it's now the time of the gentiles, unless im missing something.

That he was in conflict with Jerusalem means nothing. All people can be wrong, Paul as well as the apostles. Let God be the judge of that.

I see nothing wrong with Romans 10:6. Paul seems to using odd logic for sure, but he is getting at the fact that its faith in Jesus that saves, not faith in the Law. That matches up with Christian teachings. Also, even Abraham believed that he would have a son, and his belief was counted to him for righteousness (this was before the law was given in Genesis 15:6).

It's really interesting that you've resorted to name calling. Is that really the attitude of a person doing God's work and spreading the Word of God? Why should i listen to God if his servants insult strangers on the internet trying to have an earnest discussion?
parent.body_html:
Mathew 1:23 which is referencing Isaiah 7:14.

Well, if you think that it's impossible that a virgin can give birth, then you must also believe that this Isaiah prophesy is wrong, which would mean the Torah is corrupt. If you think virgin birth is possible, then why not Jesus? We know Joseph isn't his father, so...

This is the first time im hearing about lo-ammi, but what i can gather from google is that its a period of time where God rejects the Isreal people and deals with all nations. I'm not sure, but that seems to support Paul in his claim that it's now the time of the gentiles, unless im missing something.

That he was in conflict with Jerusalem means nothing. All people can be wrong, Paul as well as the apostles. Let God be the judge of that.

I see nothing wrong with Romans 10:6. Paul seems to using odd logic for sure, but he is getting at the fact that its faith in Jesus that saves, not faith in the Law. That matches up with Christian teachings. Also, even Abraham believed that he would have a son, and his belief was counted to him for righteousness (this was before the law was given in Genesis 15:6).

It's really interesting that you've resorted to name calling. Is that really the attitude of a person doing God's work and spreading the Word of God? Why should i listen to God if his servants insult strangers on the internet trying to have an earnest discussion?

body:
> Scripture doesn't seem to indicate heaven will be genderless

"The children of this age marry and give in marriage, but those considered worthy to obtain the next age and the resurrection from the dead neither marry or give in marriage, nor can they die anymore, as they are like angels. And they are children of God being children of the resurrection." - Luke 20:34-36

> Tradition doesn't seem to indicate heaven will be genderless

If you ignore everything early, that is.

Plus, your logic says that people born with horrible diseases and disabilities will have them forever, and if they fix or treat them on earth they will still revert back for eternity.
body_html:
Scripture doesn't seem to indicate heaven will be genderless

And they are children of God being children of the resurrection." - Luke 20:34-36

Tradition doesn't seem to indicate heaven will be genderless

If you ignore everything early, that is.

Plus, your logic says that people born with horrible diseases and disabilities will have them forever, and if they fix or treat them on earth they will still revert back for eternity.

body:
Because men show off differently. They want to show power and high status. They'll brag about an expensive pair of shoes or watch instead. They'll spend hours weightlifting to have the biggest muscles, or being the best at a sport. They want to make the most money, more to show off than because they actually want it. This is why men outcompete women in everything even when women are naturally far better at most things other than physical activity, because men want to compete and be the best and make the most money from it while women are fine doing things purely for their own enjoyment.

What it all comes down to on both sides is tactics to impress potential mates and it's all stupid and a waste of time. Even if that's not why someone is doing it, it's the reason they have the instinct to behave that way.
body_html:
Because men show off differently. They want to show power and high status. They'll brag about an expensive pair of shoes or watch instead. This is why men outcompete women in everything even when women are naturally far better at most things other than physical activity, because men want to compete and be the best and make the most money from it while women are fine doing things purely for their own enjoyment.

What it all comes down to on both sides is tactics to impress potential mates and it's all stupid and a waste of time. Even if that's not why someone is doing it, it's the reason they have the instinct to behave that way.

post.body:
Men of today dress like they're children. Loose clothing, t-shirts with gaudy slogans or worse brand logos, baseball style hats. It beclowns our gender to have grown men in public dressed like https://media.gq.com/photos/5a7d02cddd582f0b3ac186b0/master/pass/180207_NYFWMFW18-18_DR13-0032-2.jpg for example. Blacks naturally dress like fucking clowns so they won't be included in the conversation: https://i.pinimg.com/originals/f9/e8/ae/f9e8aee7f070b94517796c7b01294c5c.jpg *smh*

Now compare that to the rock who has dressed himself like a man in a well fitted suit. https://www.carderoclothing.com/uploads/6/4/6/7/64675495/5696d6583e62cb9cbff7f39f87134697_orig.jpg

https://i.pinimg.com/originals/33/39/29/33392975af56a85905622b9ea1c5f605.jpg

It's not about cost. You can buy a second hand suit from goodwill and get it tailored. I've had strangers come up to complement me on suits that I've spent less than $40 on.

So many men dress and act like children then are frustrated when they are treated like children. A suit is a way to signify to the world that you a man and as such the world will respond by treating you like a man.

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

parent.body:
This newspaper clipping is from the *Edinburg Daily Courier*, dated 29th of October, 1938 (that's not a typo, it was a newspaper for Edinburg, Indiana). This means that Mihail Toloto lived from 1856 to 1938. The name suggests that he was of Serbian or Romanian origin. His last name is sometimes given as "Tolotos", presumably under the assumption that it was a Greek name. 

As pointed out by others, the photo is of Brother Nathanael, who is very much alive right now. 

That being, imagine this monk dying, and the first woman he ever sees is the Blessed Mother of God, the greatest woman in the entire world!
parent.body_html:
This newspaper clipping is from the Edinburg Daily Courier, dated 29th of October, 1938 (that's not a typo, it was a newspaper for Edinburg, Indiana). This means that Mihail Toloto lived from 1856 to 1938. The name suggests that he was of Serbian or Romanian origin. His last name is sometimes given as "Tolotos", presumably under the assumption that it was a Greek name.

As pointed out by others, the photo is of Brother Nathanael, who is very much alive right now.

That being, imagine this monk dying, and the first woman he ever sees is the Blessed Mother of God, the greatest woman in the entire world!

post.title: How powerful was this monk?

For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God.

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.
guild.name: Christianity

post.body:
Men of today dress like they're children. Loose clothing, t-shirts with gaudy slogans or worse brand logos, baseball style hats. It beclowns our gender to have grown men in public dressed like https://media.gq.com/photos/5a7d02cddd582f0b3ac186b0/master/pass/180207_NYFWMFW18-18_DR13-0032-2.jpg for example. Blacks naturally dress like fucking clowns so they won't be included in the conversation: https://i.pinimg.com/originals/f9/e8/ae/f9e8aee7f070b94517796c7b01294c5c.jpg *smh*

Now compare that to the rock who has dressed himself like a man in a well fitted suit. https://www.carderoclothing.com/uploads/6/4/6/7/64675495/5696d6583e62cb9cbff7f39f87134697_orig.jpg

https://i.pinimg.com/originals/33/39/29/33392975af56a85905622b9ea1c5f605.jpg

It's not about cost. You can buy a second hand suit from goodwill and get it tailored. I've had strangers come up to complement me on suits that I've spent less than $40 on.

So many men dress and act like children then are frustrated when they are treated like children. A suit is a way to signify to the world that you a man and as such the world will respond by treating you like a man.
post.body_html:
Men of today dress like they're children. Loose clothing, t-shirts with gaudy slogans or worse brand logos, baseball style hats. It beclowns our gender to have grown men in public dressed like https://media.gq.com/photos/5a7d02cddd582f0b3ac186b0/master/pass/180207_NYFWMFW18-18_DR13-0032-2.jpg for example. Blacks naturally dress like fucking clowns so they won't be included in the conversation: https://i.pinimg.com/originals/f9/e8/ae/f9e8aee7f070b94517796c7b01294c5c.jpg smh

Now compare that to the rock who has dressed himself like a man in a well fitted suit. https://www.carderoclothing.com/uploads/6/4/6/7/64675495/5696d6583e62cb9cbff7f39f87134697_orig.jpg

https://i.pinimg.com/originals/33/39/29/33392975af56a85905622b9ea1c5f605.jpg

It's not about cost. You can buy a second hand suit from goodwill and get it tailored. I've had strangers come up to complement me on suits that I've spent less than $40 on.

So many men dress and act like children then are frustrated when they are treated like children. A suit is a way to signify to the world that you a man and as such the world will respond by treating you like a man.
post.title: The Suit Is The Uniform Of An Adult Man
